result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice D Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 16CF1181

Imposed and Stayed.  Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: 16CF1181

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain GED or HSED.  Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Do not drive unless properly licensed or insured.  Full compliance with Family Court Orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

Defendant Maurice D Ward in court with attorney Donald L. Conner.  Defendant Maurice D Ward in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
PSI reviewed by parties, comments made as to PSI writer's recommendation as to Count 1 in 15CF1848, which was DRI, and Count 2 was pled to.
Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing rather than have a new PSI corrected.

15CF1848
BTC: Ct. 2: I/S 10 yrs, 5 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES, 4 yrs. probation consecutive to 16CF1181.

16CF1181:
BTC: Ct. 1: 12 yrs, 7 yrs IC, 5 yrs ES.
Ct. 2: 4 yrs, 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES consecutive to Count 1.
Ct. 11: 6 yrs, 2 yrs IC, 4 yrs ES, consecutive to Count 1 & 2.
Ct. 12: 4 yrs, 2 yrs IC, 2 yrs ES consecutive to Counts 1, 2, & 11.

Conditions:
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Obtain GED/HSED.
Full compliance with Family Court Orders.
Do not drive without valid driver license and insurance.
Court costs and surcharges.
DNA sample.
CFTS

FAW/VOTE
Eligible for CIP and SAP.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to be monitored by Racine County Alternatives Program.  You must report to room MC340 in the Law Enforcement Center, 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine WI  53403 (located at the top of the stairwell to the felony courts, just to the left of the elevator) between the hours of 8:00 AM and 4:00 PM.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
